head.title: A Late Victory for the Power

hedline.hl1: A Late Victory for the Power
hedline.hl2: A Late Victory for the Power

abstract.p: New York Power defeats Boston Breakers, 3-2 (S)

block.p: For Krista Davey, late-game heroics are becoming routine.

Davey, who scored the winning goal last week in the 91st minute at Philadelphia, took advantage of a misplay by Kate Sobrero of the Boston Breakers tonight and scored in the 89th minute, giving the Power a 3-2 victory at Mitchel Field. Davey had entered the game in the 73rd minute.
The Power's Krista Davey took advantage of a misplay by Kate Sobrero of the Boston Breakers and scored in the 89th minute.
For Krista Davey, late-game heroics are becoming routine.

Davey, who scored the winning goal last week in the 91st minute at Philadelphia, took advantage of a misplay by Kate Sobrero of the Boston Breakers tonight and scored in the 89th minute, giving the Power a 3-2 victory at Mitchel Field. Davey had entered the game in the 73rd minute.

''We sent her in because her pace and energy definitely add a different dimension to our offense,'' Coach Tom Sermanni said of Davey, who was also a late-game substitution last week. ''A win like this is great because it gives them a lot of confidence, but it doesn't do me any good.''

Davey's goal was a product of good positioning and luck. Margaret Tietjen of the Power played a long ball across the field that bounced over Sobrero's foot. Davey ran to the ball in the penalty area, played the bouncing ball off her chin, and fired a shot past goalkeeper Karina LeBlanc. ''I just kept thinking, 'Play the mistake,' '' Davey said. ''It was unlucky for Kate, but we'll take it.''
Christie Welsh and Joanne Peters also scored for the Power. Maren Meinert scored twice for the Breakers.
After losing their first three games of the season, the Power (3-3) has won three straight. Boston fell to 3-2-1.
